FuncDef: The batch-backup service-type now command immediately backs up user services on an RBS.
CLIs: batch-backup service-type { all | arp | ipsec | bras | l2tp | multicast | igmp-snooping | dhcp-server | nd | dhcpv6-relay } now

ParaDef.Info:
Backs up all user services on an RBS.
-

Backs up ARP services on an RBS.
-

Backs up IPsec services on an RBS.
-

Backs up BRAS services on an RBS.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

Apply to LAC Hot Backup mode, backs up L2TP services on an RBS.
After backs up L2TP services on an RBS, backs up BRAS services on an RBS is needed.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

Backs up multicast services on an RBS.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

Backs up IGMP Snooping services on an RBS.
-

Backs up DHCP-Server on an RBS.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

Backs up ND services in an RBS.
-

Backs up DHCPv6 Relay PD routes on an RBS.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable a device to immediately back up user services on an RBS, run the batch-backup service-type command.
Prerequisites
An RBS has been created using the remote-backup-service service-name command.
Precautions
The batch-backup service-type command can back up user services only in a single direction. Therefore, you are advised to run this command on both the master and backup devices.
